poem:
Title: "Fiona's Unexpected Dance"

Oh Fiona, in this ironic grace,
Tumbled not in shame but laughter's face.
In haste you found wisdom at your feet,
Half exposed, still stunning defeat.
A sight to stir the city street,
My dear, your smile becomes the beat.
With every stumble, fall or trip,
Your laughter's the song; Life's a hip.
